abstract: New York State Joint Commission on Public Ethics issues proposal to bar elected officials from accepting or asking for campaign donations from people or groups involved in any legal action with their offices; proposal is extension of state's conflict-of-interest policies, and comes amid focus on corruption and transparency in government.
lead_paragraph: A proposal made this week by the Joint Commission on Public Ethics would extend the current rules for state employees to also include elected officials.

headline.main: Albany Plan Would Expand Conflict-of-Interest Policies
